author: Special Correspondent
text:
PROGRESSIVE OUTLOOK:Chairman of Olirum Erodu Foundation M. Chinnasamy hands over keys of two battery-operated vehicles meant for garbage collection and disposal to Corporation Commissioner M. Seeni Ajmalkhan in Erode on Saturday. —PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

Olirum Erodu Foundation has donated two battery-operated vehicles to the corporation for solid waste management in Tirungar Colony and Idayankattuvalasu in 13th and 25th wards respectively.

Capacity

The vehicles with one tonne capacity worth Rs. 3.5 lakh were handed over by OEF Chairman M. Chinnasamy to the Corporation Commissioner M. Seeni Ajmalkhan on Saturday, in the presence of the District Collector S. Prabakar, Mayor Malliga Paramasivam, Deputy Mayor K.C. Palanichamy and other dignitaries.

The OEF’s provision of the battery operated vehicles in the two wards follows a series of awareness initiatives to sensitise households to the methods of segregating bio and non-biodegradable wastes.
title: OEF donates vehicles for waste management
